message: Congressman Higgins is hosting a public town hall meeting in Youngsville, LA this Thursday. Join us at the Youngsville City Hall to have your questions answered and to hear an update on the first seven months in Congress. The town hall is part of the August work period, where Congressman Higgins will be traveling and meeting with constituents in all nine parishes.

The President continues to keep his promises to the American voters, by appointing a true Constitutionalist to the Supreme Court. It should be reassuring to Republicans and Democrats alike that the President chose someone Senator Schumer and his caucus confirmed to the federal bench in 2006. It is my hope Senate Democrats don't unnecessarily delay a nominee they've previously confirmed.

REP. CLAY HIGGINS SUPPORTS CLARIFICATION OF THE JONES ACT   WASHINGTON DC - The US Customs and Border Protection Agency recently issued clarifications for Jones Act compliance. This action brings the Jones Act back into line with its original intentions. This action will incentivize the use of American crews and ships, particularly in the energy sector. Rep. Clay Higgins (R-LA) supports these changes as they will help many of the maritime and oil and gas operations that the third congressional district relies on.    “The US Customs and Border Protections Agency’s (CBP) recent clarification of Jones Act compliance is a prime example of the work the 115th Congress will be undertaking in an effort to undo years of burdensome regulations that have caused our economy to shrink, jobs to be lost, and endangered the futures of many families around the nation,” said Rep. Clay Higgins. “The CBP ruling will bolster both Louisiana businesses and the oil and gas industry while at the same time promoting the nation’s energy independence. This is only the beginning of a renewed focus on the American worker and American economy, and I look forward to the positive impact this clarification will have on South Louisiana and the country,” said Higgins.   Employment opportunities across the third congressional district have been in decline due mainly to the recent decline in oil prices. Congressman Higgins believes this more traditional interpretation of the Jones Act will help alleviate this strain and promote economic growth and job creation.   ##

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE February 24, 2017 Press Contact: 202-225-2031  REP. CLAY HIGGINS NAMED TO ANTI-TERRORISM TASK FORCE  WASHINGTON DC - Rep. Clay Higgins (R-LA) has been appointed to serve on a bi-partisan, eight member Homeland Security Committee Task Force focused on denying terrorists entry into the United States. With the terrorist threat on the rise and immigration a key concern for the 115th Congress, this Task Force will play an important role in closing gaps in our counterterrorism screening and vetting procedures.   “It’s an honor to be chosen by Chairman McCaul, as well as my esteemed colleagues on the House Committee on Homeland Security, to serve on this vital task force,” said Rep. Clay Higgins. “The threats to America are menacing and real. My real world Law Enforcement experience will enable me to bring a boots-on-the-ground perspective, as we search together for solutions to eliminate terrorist entry into the United States and keep America safe,” said Higgins.   The Task Force will examine all pathways by which extremists might infiltrate the homeland and will seek to resolve potential weaknesses in these systems. The panel will begin work in March and will provide a final report with its findings later this year.   ##

REP. CLAY HIGGINS JOINS BI-PARTISAN CUBA WORKING GROUP   WASHINGTON D.C. – Rep. Clay Higgins has joined the Cuba Working Group. The group seeks to advance policy proposals to promote the rapidly changing status in the U.S.-Cuba relationship. As the relationship between the two nations are reshaped, the bi-partisan group seeks to advance United States economic interests on the island.    “Growing the economy is a top priority of the 115th Congress” said Rep. Clay Higgins. “Americans have suffered through a stagnant economy for almost a decade. Jobs have been scarce, particularly in southern Louisiana. I think it's time to start trading with Cuba, to bolster the economy in the third congressional district," said Higgins.    Congressman Higgins has also signed on as a co-sponsor of the Cuba Agriculture Exports Act of 2017, which seeks to remove financial restraints from American exporters to Cuba.   “I’m eager to review all future legislation that may move forward the evolving relationship between America and Cuba, particularly in the area of agricultural trade,” said Higgins. “Agriculture is a vital industry in the third congressional district. If there are opportunities for our farmers to trade with Cuba, then that’s something we’re definitely going to want to look at.”    A recent Pew public opinion poll showed increased, widespread support by Americans to end the Cuban trade embargo.   ##

REP. CLAY HIGGINS INTRODUCES FIRST PIECE OF LEGISLATION  WASHINGTON D.C. – Rep. Clay Higgins (R-LA) has introduced H.R. 1252 the “DHS Acquisition Authorities Act of 2017” as his first legislative initiative as a member of Congress. The bill is designed to create greater accountability for acquisitions programs within the Department of Homeland Security. A 2015 Government Accountability Office (GAO) report found that 20 out of the 22 major DHS acquisition programs experienced cost growth, schedule slips, or both. The “DHS Acquisition Authorities Act” will clearly designate who is responsible for each major acquisition program at DHS and requires documentation for each program that details life cycle cost estimates, cost-benefit analysis, and a detailed schedule for each project.    “As a member of the House Committee on Homeland Security, it became apparent to my colleagues and I that our current major acquisition programs are unaffordable and inefficient,” said Rep. Clay Higgins. “We want to make sure all acquisition programs are being properly overseen and managed by appropriate staff at DHS. Ensuring proper oversight and clearly designated accountability is just common sense and good practice,” said Higgins.   The legislation defines major acquisition programs as a DHS project or facility that carries a $300 million or more life cycle cost estimate. Some examples of these programs, to name a few, include the Transportation Security Administration's (TSA) Passenger Screening Program, the National Cybersecurity Protection System, the Custom and Border Protection’s (CBP) Integrated Fixed Towers, and the Federal Emergency Management Agency's (FEMA) Logistics Supply Chain Management System.  The “DHS Acquisition Authorities Act” designates the Department of Homeland Security Under Secretary for Management as the Chief Acquisition Officer and gives the Under Secretary the authority to delegate each major acquisition program to specific senior officials. The bill also outlines new requirements for the DHS Chief Procurement Officer and the DHS Chief Information Officer designed to increase accountability and budget restraint.   “The federal government’s spending is off the rails. There’s no other way to put it,” said Rep. Higgins. “There is no reason why we cannot protect our homeland, secure the border and continue to rein in spending. That’s what Americans expect of us and we have to deliver.”  The DHS Acquisition Authorities Act of 2017 is scheduled to be marked up in the House Committee on Homeland Security on Wednesday March 08, 2017.   ##

My Father taught me long ago to play pool. He was a master player. He was a brilliant man and managed to incorporate life lessons in everything he did with me. Dad advised me, regarding billiards and life, that if I shoot a scared stick, I'll always lose.   The removal of longstanding monuments of American Veterans reflects weakness and fear. Our history is our history. Good or bad, uplifting or depressing, righteous or dark... our American history is ours, all of it, we've earned it. To hide or destroy selected historical monuments reflects a society unwilling or unable to accept the reality of our entire history. If we shoot a scared stick, we ultimately lose.   That being said, as a dedicated Constitutionalist, I completely support States rights and the right of municipalities and local governing authorities to conduct their business according to the dictates and will of their own citizenry within the parameters of their own laws and civil procedures. Healthy, meaningful debate should be engaged and encouraged at the local and State level regarding any controversial act of the governing authority.   America is replete with Patriot fervor. It is always my prayer, that my fellow Americans will engage. Only through candid, thoughtful discussion, can we evolve as a Nation reflective of our Saviors intent.   Captain Clay Higgins

CONGRESSMAN HIGGINS WRITES LETTER TO GOV. EDWARDS URGING STATE TO BLOCK THE REVISION OF OUR HISTORY  WASHINGTON, D.C. – Congressman Clay Higgins, R-LA, sent a letter to Governor John Bel Edwards today, calling on the State of Louisiana to support measures blocking the removal of several historical monuments in New Orleans.  The letter reads, “The current spectacle in New Orleans reflects a culture of growing weakness and fear. Our history is our history. Good or bad, uplifting or depressing, righteous or dark…our American history is ours, all of it, and we’ve earned it. Hiding or destroying longstanding monuments of American veterans is a mistake with serious consequences and a denial of the reality of our entire history.”  Congressman Higgins notes that this decision is ultimately in the hands of the state and the City of New Orleans, and he strongly urges the Governor to take action to preserve the monuments.  “Our state is facing serious challenges. We should be focused on the real issues at hand, instead of getting stuck on needless distractions,” said Rep. Higgins.

For seven years, Obamacare has devoured itself, collapsing and leaving American families with fewer choices, higher premiums, and crushing deductibles. Today, we fulfilled a promise to the American people to restore the free market and provide greater access to cost-effective health insurance.  The American Health Care Act: defunds Planned Parenthood, repeals the individual and employer mandates, repeals nearly $1 trillion in Obamacare taxes, brings insurance providers back to the marketplace and lowers premiums, maintains coverage for pre-existing conditions, preserves the ability for parents to keep children on their health plan until age 26, and restores governance power to the 50 sovereign states, adding flexibility to respond to their own unique challenges.

Congressman Higgins' bill to establish a department-wide employee misconduct policy and promote a culture of responsibility at DHS just passed the House. The bill allows the Chief Human Capital Officer at DHS to identify and address causes of persistent employee misconduct more effectively.
150 days in. Fighting for We, the People.

I’m glad to see President Trump sign this landmark piece of legislation into law. There have been too many instances of veterans at the VA dying while they waited for care. I am a loud and vocal supporter of bringing much-needed change to the VA, which is why I co-sponsored the House version of this legislation, and why I continue to work with my colleagues on the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee to fight on behalf of my veteran brothers and sisters.  American veterans deserve the finest care in the world, and our mission is to ensure that they have access to high-quality, timely care. This law allows Secretary Shulkin to change the status quo and hold bad actors at the VA responsible for misconduct on the taxpayer’s dime. Our mission is to raise accountability and hold VA employees to a higher standard.

This decision is a major victory for American national security interests and efforts to protect our homeland. The threats facing our nation are menacing and real, and the status quo immigration policy falls short. President Trump’s actions to reform America’s immigration system and place a temporary restraint on foreign citizens traveling from countries known to foster radicalized Islamic jihadist terrorists are both necessary and reasonable. President Trump has kept his promise to place the interests of American citizens first, and this policy adds a much-needed layer of security to our immigration system.

This week, Congress is voting to crack down on sanctuary cities and empower law enforcement agents on our borders. Earlier this year, Congressman Higgins toured the southern border with the House Homeland Security Committee to learn from the boots-on-the-ground. We're going to get those men and women the resources they need to secure our border.  Watch Part 1: https://www.facebook.com/CongressmanClayHiggins/videos/443047636044102/ Border Patrol dangers: https://www.facebook.com/Breitbart/videos/10158875172550354/

No state has been more impacted by the EPA’s injurious regulations during the Obama Administration than Louisiana. The Waters of the United States rule represents a clear example of the kind of federal overreach and onerous regulations that were designed to grow the federal government, restrict the People's freedoms, and devour the People's treasure. Repealing these regulations reflects my Constitutionalist ideology, restores powers to the 50 sovereign states, and restores every Americans right to manage our own land.

Local airports are critical to economic and industrial activity in South Louisiana. Travelers, farmers, offshore energy workers, and recreational pilots all depend on our regional and municipal airports. I am proud to announce this funding that will provide much needed infrastructure improvements and ensure that our community airports remain safe and continue to expand.

After a decade of cuts that slashed almost 25 percent of the defense budget, Congress is rebuilding and strengthening our military. The NDAA represents a major commitment to our Armed Forces, the world's first line of defense against oppression, terror, and military aggression. We have a responsibility to provide those men and women with the weapons and technology that they need. This plan bolsters American defense initiatives in rapidly evolving theaters of engagement and ensures that our boots on the ground have the necessary resources to defend our homeland and keep America safe.

Congressman Clay Higgins and Congressman Mike Johnson are leading a bipartisan group of lawmakers to introduce comprehensive, bicameral legislation that reauthorizes and reforms the National Flood Insurance Program. The bill protects policyholders from skyrocketing premiums and reauthorizes the NFIP for six years, while also reforming current practices to improve flood mapping, increase affordability, and raise participation from private insurers.

American energy... of every kind... should be a steady stream of export revenue. We can safely, but effectively lower restrictions on the energy industry, including nuclear power technology. Today's House Science Committee gave me an opportunity to inquire about unleashing American energy potential by rolling back regulatory overreach, bringing jobs and growth to our communities.
About to speak live on the House floor in support of my bill to reauthorize DHS and ensure that the Department stays mission-ready and able to protect our homeland. Tune in below.

Proud to stand with Chairman McCaul and members of the Homeland Security Committee in sponsoring the DHS Authorization Act of 2017. National Security is an issue that effects every man, woman, and child, Republicans and Democrats in our nation. This bill will go a long way in ensuring that DHS remains mission ready to continue protecting our homeland.

The United States faces dynamic national security challenges brought forth by radical Islamist terrorists, human traffickers, drug smugglers, and nation-states waging a silent war in cyberspace. Since the original authorization 15 years ago, DHS has never been reauthorized, leading to inefficiencies and lack of congressional oversight. This comprehensive reauthorization asserts Congress’ Article I oversight authority, streamlines and consolidates programs, protects taxpayer dollars, holds DHS more accountable, improves national security, and supports front-line defenders.

The best rice in the world is grown in the heart of Acadiana, with Louisiana rice farmers already contributing more than $700 million to the state’s economic output each year. Expanding rice exports, while ensuring that Louisiana farmers are competing on a level playing field, supports thousands of jobs and generates much-needed economic activity in rice country.

The biggest change in the last 15 years is an evolving homeland security landscape that includes cyber threats, terrorism, and human and drug trafficking. The landmark bill that passed yesterday ensures that DHS is evolving to meet 21st century challenges and stays mission-ready to defend our homeland.
Great to be in St. Martinville with sugarcane farmers and the LSU AgCenter, discussing how our office is working to promote Louisiana agriculture.

Great meeting with Department of the Interior Secretary Zinke and members of the Louisiana delegation today, discussing the importance of GOMESA funding.

The United States is on the cusp of becoming a net energy exporter for the first time in history and natural gas is leading the way. Southwest Louisiana is the epicenter of this energy revolution. Our legislation rolls back red tape and unleashes America’s energy potential for the first time in nearly a decade, which means jobs and economic growth for our communities. I’m very glad to be working with Sen. Bill Cassidy on this critical endeavor.

Had the privilege to join my friend Congressman Jodey Arrington on the House floor last night, speaking about agriculture and rural America. Given a level playing field and opportunities to compete on a global scale – American farmers will always win.
Glad to be working with Sen. Bill Cassidy on this critical endeavor for Louisiana and American energy.

“Family caregivers are a critical support system for our wounded veterans. Their sacrifices help our veterans recover and make day-to-day life possible,” said Rep. Higgins. “We have a sacred obligation to care for our veterans and, by extension, the unsung heroes who tend to their everyday needs.”

The national security funding bill upholds a promise to the American people to rebuild our military and secure our homeland. I am proud to announce that this bill includes the highest level of funding ever for the VA, includes $1.6 billion for the border wall, and provides our Armed Forces with the largest pay raise in 8 years. This bill also makes needed investments to resurrect our crumbling military infrastructure and upgrade defense technology. We are taking real action to secure our borders and keep American families safe.

Color does not define us. Ethnicity does not define us. Race does not define us. All of mankind was created in God's own image. We are one, bonded by spirit.  Violence against our fellow citizen based on race is not an American value... not a Christian value... and should never be condoned. In this time, I am reminded of Philippians 2:3 KJV:  "Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves."  The historical struggles of mankind to embrace the true love of brotherhood, as intended by Christ, continues. Our nation, our world, seeks redemption. But redemption is not a destination. It's a journey. Each of us is on that journey. Our nation...though anointed by God... is on that journey. Let us pray for peace amongst our fellow Americans.  Captain Clay Higgins

From the National Weather Service, 5:00 PM CST:  Hurricane Harvey is strengthening quickly, and is expected to be a major category 3 hurricane by landfall on the central Texas coast Saturday morning. Harvey will weaken to a tropical storm by Sunday, before moving back offshore and heading towards the upper Texas or southwest Louisiana coastline next week. It's too early to say how strong the storm could be for a second landfall next week. Long duration of heavy rain and flooding will be possible across our region Sunday into next week.   Storm surge is expected one to three feet above ground level for coastal areas. Winds could gust in the 25-35 mph range along coastal sections of Louisiana late Friday into Saturday morning. The tornado threat is very small for the weekend.  Sandbag locations available here: https://clayhiggins.house.gov/media/press-releases/sandbag-locations-hurricane-harvey
NA
NA
NA

Hurricane Harvey is still expected to make landfall in Texas late tonight/early tomorrow morning most likely as a category 3 storm. The largest threat for South Louisiana remains heavy rainfall and inland flooding, with current rain projections of 8-12 inches and 1-3 foot storm surge between the Texas - Louisiana border and Morgan City.  A mandatory evacuation has been called for portions of Cameron Parish, and Vermilion Parish officials have issued a voluntary evacuation. Our staff is closely monitoring this storm and will be sharing updates periodically.  Please consider filling up your vehicles with gas. The storm will likely affect the transportation of gasoline in Texas and Louisiana, which could greatly diminish supply. Be safe.  Sandbags are available at these locations: https://clayhiggins.house.gov/media/press-releases/sandbag-locations-hurricane-harvey
NA
NA

Harvey has been downgraded to tropical storm status but continues to threaten Texas and parts of South Louisiana with storm surge and heavy rainfall. Latest rainfall projections show portions of Southwest Louisiana receiving approximately 10 inches of rain over the duration of the storm. Potential for tornado activity in South Louisiana will increase as the day progresses.  FEMA has prepositioned resources throughout the region and first responders are active.   Voluntary evacuations remain for Iberia and Vermilion parishes, and a mandatory evacuation remains for parts of Cameron Parish. One shelter has been opened in Rapides Parish by the Red Cross.   Citizens are encouraged to download the FEMA mobile app for real-time updates and information on shelter resources and disaster assistance.   Please continue to pray for our neighbors in Texas who are enduring the brunt of this storm.  Sandbag locations in South Louisiana are listed on our website: https://clayhiggins.house.gov/media/press-releases/sandbag-locations-hurricane-harvey
NA
NA
NA

10:30 AM CST update from the NWS:  Tropical Storm Harvey remains a threat to South Louisiana. The center of the storm is right off the central Texas coast where it is expected to move to the north and east. The storm is not expected to strengthen significantly.  Cameron Parish is under a tropical storm warning and Vermilion Parish is under a tropical storm watch. Storm surge of 1-3 feet is expected as Harvey moves closer toward a second landfall on Wednesday morning.  Heavy rainfall remains the primary threat, with 10-15 inches expected in SWLA through Friday and 5-10 inches in the Acadiana region.  Isolated tornadoes, especially south of the I-10 corridor, remain a potential threat.  Please continue to monitor local news and weather information closely.
NA
The very latest storm data...

Harvey is a weak tropical storm near the central Texas coast. It will slowly head towards the upper Texas coast, before making landfall Wednesday morning as a tropical storm.  The major storyline with this system will continue to be the heavy rain and dangerous flood threat, especially in southeast Texas and southwest Louisiana. Storm total values could approach the 30 to 40 inch range in parts of southeast Texas.  This system is not expected to strengthen significantly, wind-wise. However due to the track forecast, a tropical storm warning is in effect for Jefferson County and Cameron and Vermilion Parishes. Expect to see wind gusts in the 30 to 40 mph range near the coast in the warning area.  Storm Surge will be one to three feet AGL. During the period of high tides tonight and Tuesday, expect to see coastal flooding in Jefferson County, and Cameron, Vermilion, Iberia, and St. Mary Parishes.  We are forecasting another 8 to 15 inches of rain in southeast Texas, 6 to 10 inches in southwest Louisiana, 5 to 8 inches in south central Louisiana, and 4 to 8 inches in central Louisiana. Note: There is potential for higher rain totals in southwest and/or south central Louisiana, depending on where the rain bands develop.  There will be a threat for isolated tornadoes tonight and tomorrow.
NA

Please continue to remain vigilant as Tropical Storm Harvey impacts our region. Congressman Higgins and our office are communicating daily with local emergency officials, FEMA, and the National Weather Service. We will continue to share information as it becomes available.

Want to volunteer during Tropical Storm Harvey? Here's where you can learn more about how you can help.

Here is the 430 pm Tuesday update: Harvey strengthened a little this afternoon, and is moving faster. Landfall will be 9 pm to 2 am tonight near Sabine Pass, Texas.  Couple of things to note: - with heavy saturation from the rain, winds have increased potential to knock down trees and power lines.  - storm surge will combine with high tide and will inhibit drainage of rainfall as it accumulates. - the primary threat remains heavy rainfall. - if you are in a flood-prone area or believe that the water around you is getting high, request assistance now before it gets dark.  - please stay off the roadways if possible to allow first responders to act swiftly and effectively.

Earlier this year, Congressman Higgins warned the House Science committee about potential cyber threats associated with using Kaspersky Lab products. In July, the U.S. General Services Administration removed Kaspersky Lab from its approved list of vendors, which Congressman Higgins told Morning Consult was a positive step to "stop the bleeding" and address potential cyber threats.   Today's move from the Department of Homeland Security is a welcome development to ensure that federal agencies are not exposed to potential cyber threats.  Read Congressman Higgins' July interview with Morning Consult here --> https://morningconsult.com/2017/07/31/lawmakers-rethink-federal-use-kaspersky-lab-products/

Great tour of the Bayou Rum distillery in Lacassine this afternoon, seeing the entire distilling process and discussing how our office is working to fix the tax cover-over program hurting craft rum producers in the United States.

This levee in Gueydan that was breached during 2016's historic rain event went unrepaired for more than a year, putting homes and businesses at risk of flooding during Hurricane Harvey. That's unacceptable. We should be investing thousands for better water management infrastructure rather than spending millions or billions of dollars in disaster relief. Glad to have worked with Alderman Jason Suire to get this issue resolved and mitigate future threats.

Veterans and their families have made the ultimate sacrifice for our country, and we must uphold our promises to them.
Honored to receive the "Heartbeat Bill Hero" award for serving as a cosponsor of H.R. 490, the Heartbeat Protection Act, and for my strong commitment to protecting the sanctity of life.

It’s been more than three decades since we’ve reformed our tax code. The current 74,608-page federal tax code is outdated and overly complex. American families deserve to keep more of their hard-earned paychecks, and we need bold reform to really grow our economy. That’s what this GOP foundational tax reform framework delivers.   Of course, my colleagues and I will engage in vigorous debate regarding details and concerns, and this initial framework will change. However, this cornerstone upon...which we will build...does indeed reflect a fairer, simpler tax code that strengthens our economy, creates job growth, and allows individual Americans, as well as all American businesses, to keep more of what they’ve earned.  I strongly support significant reform of our tax code so that everyday American families and small businesses can take charge of their finances and spend, save, or invest however they see fit. I urge all of my colleagues, on both sides of the aisle to come together and get this thing done for all Americans.  Learn more about the framework here → https://goo.gl/Sd2JY6

Unspeakable grief.  Over 50 murdered and hundreds injured in Las Vegas. In Louisiana, a Cop shot dead on the streets of Lafayette.  The horror from within.   May God have mercy on us all.   Captain Clay Higgins

This evening, the House passed the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act to create greater protections for the unborn and restrict late-term abortions. Life is a fundamental and unalienable right, and this bill would give millions of unborn children a chance to live. I am a strong supporter of pro-life priorities and will always vote to protect the unborn.

Americans are frustrated with Washington’s failure over the last 8 years to enforce our existing immigration laws. Securing our borders is first and foremost a national security issue. We must take greater action to combat illegal human and drug trafficking. Our bill authorizes all necessary assets to secure the border, including tactical infrastructure, physical barriers, and advanced technology like drones and surveillance dirigibles.

Disaster declaration for Louisiana is righteous, merciful, and overdue.  Captain Clay Higgins   "Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need." Hebrews 4:16 KJV

This disaster declaration for Louisiana is righteous and long overdue. The Parishes of Southwest Louisiana experienced major damage to homes, businesses, and infrastructure that extend beyond the capabilities of state and local government. My office has worked tirelessly to highlight this need, ensuring that Louisiana isn’t absent from the conversation about hurricane relief. I’m thankful that President Trump and his administration have been responsive to our constant outreach. Thanks to this decision, the patriots of South Louisiana will have access to the resources they need to rebuild and recover.

The previous administration acted as a predator to the oil and gas and petrochemical industry, costing many thousands of jobs across South Louisiana. Working closely with President Trump and his administration, we are following through on our commitment to unleash American energy potential and create new opportunities for hard-working Americans. From day one, this effort has been about working-class Americans and delivering tax relief for the middle class. That’s exactly what this bill does. It allows American families to keep more of their hard-earned paychecks and provides incentives to spur economic growth and new job creation for businesses of all sizes. All Americans will benefit from this package, and I see no reason why this shouldn’t be a bipartisan effort. I am hopeful that we can move this bill quickly through the House and Senate.

Home health services are critical for many of our elderly, especially in rural communities. I’m uplifted to see the administration preserve these programs. I firmly believe that we have a responsibility to care for our elders. The idea that redirecting funds from home health programs to hospitals would have created savings at the Federal level is unsound. Ultimately, this is a wise and righteous investment that preserves access to quality, in-home healthcare for the most vulnerable Americans.

Both the Children’s Health Insurance Program and community health centers provide health services to low-income and under-served populations. I was glad to see the House pass measures that reauthorize and extend both programs in a fiscally responsible manner that protects taxpayer dollars while prioritizing healthcare for the most vulnerable Americans.
Great to be in Acadia Parish yesterday for the Crowley Veterans Day Ceremony, honoring the brave men and women who have served our country.

Glad to support my friend Rep. Brian Babin's amendment that would allow us to better and more strategically manage our dams, flood gates, and reservoirs in advance of storms like Hurricane Harvey. It is time we stop being a reactive body, only addressing the needs to repair and rebuild after natural disasters, and start focusing on proactive solutions to mitigate potential damage before it is caused.

In advance of Veterans Day, the U.S. House of Representatives passed more than a dozen reform measures aimed at improving and modernizing veterans healthcare. Veterans shouldn't be forced to travel hundreds or thousands of miles to receive care. The VICTOR Act, which I cosponsored, is one example of our work to provide veterans with health procedures in their own communities.
Humbled to participate in the Veterans Day and roll call ceremony at the University of Louisiana at Lafayette, honoring the service and sacrifice of Louisiana's veterans.
Humbled to take part in Veterans Day events throughout Acadiana this weekend. Beautifully uplifting ceremonies in Breaux Bridge, Lafayette, and New Iberia honoring our nation's heroes.
The U.S. Chamber of Commerce confirms that the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act will lead to more jobs, larger paychecks, and greater economic growth for Louisiana's third congressional district.

We’re moving forward with our pro-growth plan to ignite our economy and deliver historic tax relief. This is a big win for working-class Americans. We’re going to witness tremendous economic growth for businesses of all sizes, creating new jobs and opportunity that will benefit all American workers and families. The Senate must act quickly on tax reform legislation so that we can go to Conference, hammer out the details through respectful debate, and send a bill to President Trump’s desk before the end of the year.

As we reflect upon our lives this Thanksgiving, let us, as We, the People be thankful as a nation to be American. Let us be joyous of heart that these United States are once again lead by a President who loves our nation and our heritage, who appreciates the journey of our history, and who recognizes the potential of our future... as America reestablishes our rightful and sober responsibility as leader of the free world.  -Captain Clay Higgins

Pleased to announce the winners of The Congressional App Challenge for Louisiana's third district. The winning team's app "Rescue Me" helps connect volunteers with victims in the wake of a natural disaster.   I also want to thank LPSS GEAR UP, A New Vision Leadership Foundation of Acadiana, and the staff at CGI for partnering with my office to promote this initiative. Their guidance and outreach was a tremendous help to the students.
The security threats facing our homeland are rapidly evolving. So must our efforts to defeat them.

We are another step closer toward historic tax relief, and I want to commend my Senate colleagues for delivering this important victory for the American people. This bill is going to conference committee next week, and I’m optimistic that we can put final legislation on President Trump’s desk before the end of the year. We’re going to see tremendous economic growth and new opportunities for all Americans.

Great group of students representing Louisiana's third district as the winners of The Congressional App Challenge. Their app, "Rescue Me," helps volunteers connect with victims in the wake of natural disasters.

"Shall not be infringed," was not intended by the drafters of our Constitution and Bill of Rights to be a suggestion. Every American that can legally possess and own a weapon, and carry in whatever manner, should have that protection in every state across the nation. The fundamental and Constitutional right to bear arms should not end at state lines. This is common sense legislation, and I’m proud to serve as a cosponsor. I will always vote to defend and uphold Second Amendment rights for all Americans.

ISIS and its caliphate have been beaten back in the Middle East thanks to President Trump's decisive action to empower our military leaders. However, foreign fighters have increasingly sought to infiltrate the United States and other western nations to radicalize others and carry out cowardly, 'lone-wolf' attacks. We must identify and destroy this evil wherever it exists, while also bolstering our own security mechanisms to protect our homeland.  As part of his work on the Task Force on Denying Terrorists Entry into the United States, Congressman Clay Higgins (R-LA) has introduced H.R. 4564, the Post-Caliphate Threat Assessment Act of 2017. The bill would require the Secretary of Homeland Security, the Secretary of State, and the Director of National Intelligence to issue a detailed report of terrorist movements and activity hotbeds to Congress. More specifically, the report would include analysis of the countries of origin, intended destinations, and means of travel utilized by terrorist fighters as well as an in-depth documentation of terrorist activity in Iraq and Syria.

I’ll be LIVE soon (5:50 pm CST), talking to constituents in South Louisiana. Participate in the conversation by streaming here clayhiggins.house.gov/live or dialing 877-229-8493, and entering the pin 116628.

"Bayou Bridge is part of our efforts to bring new jobs and economic growth to South Louisiana. The oil and gas and petrochemical industry remains the cornerstone of our state’s economy, and we’re working to unleash our energy potential. This project provides critical pipeline infrastructure for refiners and producers across the state. Bayou Bridge will create thousands of jobs for Louisiana families. Army Corps of Engineers Commander Colonel Clancy and I have cultivated an ‘Army strong’ professional relationship. We’re determined to work together, identify obstacles, and overcome the bureaucracies that have restricted permit approval for major projects in the past. My Congressional staff and I will continue to attack, one battle at a time. Getting Bayou Bridge rolling is major... but we’re not done."

The conference committee has issued its report on the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act  →  ✔ Lowers individual tax rates ✔ Doubles the standard deduction  ✔ Expands the child tax credit to $2,000 ✔ Lowers the corporate rate to 21% ✔ Repeals the Obamacare individual mandate ✔ Maintains tuition waivers for graduate students ✔ Lowers taxes for small businesses ✔ Tax relief for Louisiana flood victims ✔ Increases offshore revenue sharing under GOMESA  Read the bill and learn more at https://fairandsimple.gop
